channel.title: julia on Yuvi
channel.description: Recent content in julia on Yuvi

item.title: Precompiling Julia Packages in Docker Images
item.description: Julia pre-compiles packages on first load, allowing them to deeply optimize the generated code for the particular CPU architecture the user is running on for maximum performance. However, it does take some time, so there’s a startup latency penalty here. If you make docker images with precompiled Julia packages, you can pay this pre-compilation penalty at image build time, rather than at image startup time. Much better for your users!
